questions.question: Because smoking among children (especially young children) continues at truly epidemic levels, and many believe that cigarette advertising is at least partially to blame, other countries have banned tobacco advertising. Do you believe the United States should:
options: Require free space for antismoking messages
Do nothing to restrict general tobacco advertising

questions.question: As mentioned above, smoking costs the public tens of billions of dollars every year in increased health care costs - most of which are paid by nonsmokers in the form of higher taxes, health insurance premiums, etc. As a result, do you feel the government should:
options: Require smokers to pay more for health insurance
Permit insurance companies to charge smokers more
Prohibit insurance companies from charging smokers more

questions.question: Would you be willing to spend just a few cents a day in support of ASH's efforts to fight back against the enormously powerful tobacco giants and to defend the rights of the nonsmoking public?
options: If Yes, please see form below

subscription.message: Yes! I'm sick and tired of breathing other peoples' smoke and having my hard-earned tax dollars subsidize ASH. Please begin my subscription to Smoking and Health Review at once. My contribution is for:
subscription.note: Contributions to ASH are tax deductible.
